title: Fix final reveal to display the user-provided uploaded image (not a random image)

requirements.text: In the final step of the bottom "OneMoreThingInteraction" reveal (after the third click), display the user-provided uploaded image (original filename: "627674318_941888025190821_1390922055753035112_n.jpg") instead of any placeholder/random image, by ensuring the correct file exists under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` with a clean stable filename and that `frontend/src/components/OneMoreThingInteraction.tsx` references that exact public URL.

acceptanceCriteria: The final surprise view (step >= 3) renders the user-provided photo (from the upload "627674318_941888025190821_1390922055753035112_n.jpg") and not any other image.
The image is served as a static asset from `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and referenced via a `/assets/generated/...` URL (no backend image serving).
The image renders correctly in Chrome on Windows and still uses appropriate sizing (e.g., contained with a max height) and rounded corners consistent with the current theme.
There are no broken image links (no 404) when reaching the final surprise view.

constraints: Do not edit any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (compose them only).
Keep the app fully client-side; do not serve images via the backend.
Maintain the existing single-actor Motoko backend architecture; no backend changes are required for this fix.
nonGoals: Do not change the multi-step labels or the final message text content.
Do not redesign the overall Valentine page layout or add new interactions beyond fixing the image source.
